Summary: Orange object moved slowly from south-southwest to north-northeast, stopped, then disappeared straight up at high rate of speed.
divs: sighting detailsi was sitting outside smoking a cigarette, facing northwest, on a clear day with only a few wispy clouds. i routinely watch the skies. never know what i'll see. today i noticed a bright deep-orange object almost drifting from ssw to nne across my line of vision. at first, i thought i was seeing an inflated advertising balloon\blimp that had come untethered and was escaping. there was only a slight breeze on the ground, less than 5 mph probably, and the few scattered clouds were not visibly moving at all. this orange object did not drift upward, as an escaping balloon might. it moved steadily in a horizontal nne direction, at about 75-80 degrees above the horizon. i got a pair of (inexpensive) binoculars and with them the object appeared to be a bright orange cube, slowly rotating on one point of the cube, with black semicircular areas at the two corners of the cube, which were the leading edge and trailing edges of the cube, given the direction of travel. these semicircles were large, deep black, and pulsated on and off at regular intervals. it made no sound, had no visible means of propulsion, and was moving slowly and steadily. i cannot estimate the height or size of the object very well. it was at approximately 75-80 degrees above the horizon, and could have been any distance out from me; i extended my arm\thumb, and the object appeared about 1\2 the size of my thumbnail. when first seen, the object was to my right, in a line of sight with the sky over nellis air force base. my next thought that the object originated at the base, but its line of movement was from over the city, not the base--hence the escaped balloon theory. the nellis jets routinely fly over my house when returning to land at the base; this object was traveling in the opposite direction, and no other aircraft were immediately visible. then, from my left, a small, one-propeller airplane came from the nnw, approaching nellis at a fairliy low altitude, as if on landing approach. it was white, with red strips, which i'm told are nellis planes; they are seen frequently here. i'm also told that the air space in my neighborhood is restricted to air force traffic, that commercial aircraft from mccarran field and from a smaller, private airport in north las vegas do not use the airspace. very infrequently, when winds are bad, some commercial outbound flights from mccarran are routed just south of us, but they always follow a specific path and are easily distinguished from nellis jets by their speed, markings, and light configurations. the small airplane i observed was lower than the ufo, and did not deviate from its flightpath. the orange object continued slowly nne, then stopped, then started forward again. no other craft were in the sky by that time. the black pulsing half moons were still operating. the object paused a second time, the black halfmoons switched off, and then the craft shot straight up; no sound, tremendous speed. i searched the sky with the field glasses, but no sign of it anywhere.
